meanings.definition: Verify (information) by using an alternative source or method.
meanings.sent1: I always crosscheck the facts before writing my report.
meanings.sent2: It is important to crosscheck the data to ensure its accuracy.
meanings.sent3: I decided to crosscheck the recipe with my friend just to be sure.
meanings.sent4: She likes to crosscheck her schedule with her phone calendar.
meanings.sent5: Remember to crosscheck the address before sending the invitation.

meanings.definition: A check or verification against another source or method.
meanings.sent1: The accountant performed a crosscheck to confirm the numbers.
meanings.sent2: The crosscheck revealed a discrepancy in the records.
meanings.sent3: The crosscheck between the two lists showed a mistake in the data entry.
meanings.sent4: The crosscheck acted as a safety net to catch any errors.
meanings.sent5: Make sure to do a crosscheck of the information before finalizing the report.
